_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

How a mendicant is mindful [sn47.35:3.7]: They meditate by observing an aspect of the body
They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings
They meditate by observing an aspect of mind
They meditate by observing an aspect of principles
How a mendicant is aware [sn47.35:3.7]: They know feelings as they arise, remain, and go away
They know thoughts as they arise, remain, and go away
They know perceptions as they arise, remain, and go away
